sentence.text: Prostate cancer is the most common non-skin cancer in males, with a âˆ¼1.5-2-fold higher incidence in African American men when compared with whites.

In this first whole-exome sequencing study of prostate cancer, our findings do not provide strong support for the hypothesis that NS coding variants down to 0.5-1.0% frequency have large effects on prostate cancer risk in men of African ancestry.
